Authors: Lisa Matamoros, Emilia Rota, Christer Erséus
Title:
Cryptic diversity within the Marionina achaeta species
complex (Annelida, Clitellata, Enchytraeidae)
Keywords:
Oligochaeta, Enchytraeidae, Marionina, Marionina achaeta
complex, Genetic diversity, Phylogeny, Cryptic species, M. nothachaeta
nom.nov, Neotype
Abstract:
In this study we define the Marionina achaeta complex as a
marine group of species within the genus Marionina that lack chaetae. It
includes the four nominal species: M. achaeta (Hagen, 1954), M. achaeta
sensu Lasserre, 1964, M. nevisensis Righi & Kanner, 1979 and M.
arenaria Healy, 1979. We studied the genetic and morphological diversity
of achaetous specimens of Marionina collected in Florida, USA; Great
Barrier Reef, Queensland, Australia; New Caledonia; Sweden; England; and
the Bahamas. The collection localities are almost all supralittoral and
vary from fully marine to brackish habitats; some are temporarily in
freshwater after rain. Parts of the mitochondrial genes 12S, 16S, COI,
and the nuclear genes 18S, 28S, ITS were sequenced and analysed to
assess the genetic variation and estimate the phylogeny of the achaetous
Marionina species. The molecular data reveal one monophyletic group of
at least nine separately evolving lineages: M. achaeta sensu Lasserre,
1964, M. nevisensis s.str., M. sp. A, M. sp. B, M. sp. D, M. sp. E, M.
sp. H, M. sp. I and M. sp. J, most of which are not associated with any
described nominal taxon. Variation in COI, shows high diversity, both
within (up to 10.4 %) and between lineages (15.6-25 %). Morphologically,
however, we can discriminate only seven lineages. Marionina nevisensis
s.str., M. sp. D, and E match the description of M. nevisensis and are
therefore considered to be cryptic species. We also select a neotype for
M. nevisensis from the Caribbean region, and as Lasserres (1964) M.
achaeta appears to be morphologically different from its (then) senior
homonym M. achaeta (Hagen, 1954), we propose a placement name, M.
nothachaeta nom.nov., for it.
